TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit LogMethodAttribute extends System.Attribute
Public NotInheritable Class LogMethodAttribute Inherits Attribute
public ref class LogMethodAttribute sealed : Attribute

Docs.summary: Provides information to guide the production of a strongly-typed logging method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class which is used to guide the production of a strongly-typed logging method.
Docs.remarks:
This overload is not commonly used. In general, the overload that accepts a value is preferred.
The method this attribute is applied to has some constraints: - Logging methods must be partial, and return void. - Logging methods cannot be generic or accept any generic parameters. - Logging method names must not start with an underscore. - Parameter names of logging methods must not start with an underscore. - If the logging method is static, one of its parameters must be of type , or a type that implements the interface. - If the logging method is an instance method, one of the fields of the containing type must be of type .
This overload doesn't specify an event id, it is set to 0, nor it specifies a message template - it is an empty string.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.LogLevel level) cil managed

Docs.param: The logging level produced when invoking the strongly-typed logging method.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class which is used to guide the production of a strongly-typed logging method.
Docs.remarks:
The method this attribute is applied to has some constraints - Logging methods must be partial, and return void. - Logging methods cannot be generic or accept any generic parameters. - Logging method names must not start with an underscore. - Parameter names of logging methods must not start with an underscore. - If the logging method is static, one of its parameters must be of type , or a type that implements the interface. - If the logging method is an instance method, one of the fields of the containing type must be of type .
This overload doesn't specify an event id, it is set to 0.

Docs.param: The stable event id for this log message.

Docs.param: The message text output by the logging method. This string is a template that can contain any of the method's parameters. Defaults to empty.

This overload doesn't specify an event id, it is set to 0.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property EventId As Integer
public: property int EventId { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the logging event id for the logging method.
Docs.remarks: This is 0 if the logging method doesn't have a stable event id.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.EventName : string with get, set
public: property System::String ^ EventName { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the logging event name for the logging method.
Docs.remarks: This will equal the method name if not specified.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Level As Nullable(Of LogLevel)

Docs.summary: Gets the logging level for the logging method.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Message As String
public: property System::String ^ Message { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the message text for the logging method.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.SkipEnabledCheck : bool with get, set
public: property bool SkipEnabledCheck { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the generated code should omit the logic to check whether a log level is enabled.
Docs.value: The default value is if the log method's logging level is Error or Critical; otherwise the default value is .
Docs.remarks: The generated code contains an optimization to avoid calling into the underlying if the log method's log level is currently not enabled. If your application is already performing this check before calling the logging method, then you can remove the redundant check performed in the generated code by setting this option to .
